definition[0]: based on guessing, not on information or facts
example[0]: a purely speculative theory about life on other planets
definition[1]: bought or done in the hope of making a profit later
definition[2]: if you give someone a speculative look, you look at them while trying to guess something about them
definition[3]: bought or done in the hope of making a profit
example[2]: Their £461 million bid for the electronics company led to a good deal of speculative activity yesterday.
example[3]: Prices fell on heavy speculative selling after the weekend.
example[4]: These figures are, at best, speculative.
example[5]: She dismisses rumours of a boardroom split as “totally speculative”.
